Paper 1.stem: ABC is a triangle. D is the point on BC such that $3BD=2DC.$ $\vec{AB} = m$ and $\vec{AC} = n$.
Paper 1.diagramDescription: Triangle ABC with D on BC. Vector arrows for m and n.

parts.questionText: Find $\vec{AD}$ in terms of m and n.
R is on AD produced such that $\vec{AR}=k\vec{AD}$ and AC is parallel to BR. Show that $k=\frac{5}{3}$.
Find the ratio of area of triangle ABD to area of triangle RBD.

Paper 1.title: Vectors

Paper 1.stem: In the diagram below, PQRST is a trapezium made up of a parallelogram PQRS and an isosceles triangle PST where $PT=PS$. It is given that $\vec{RS}=\mathbf{a}$, $\vec{RQ}=\mathbf{b}$ and $SR=ST$.
Paper 1.diagramDescription: Trapezium PQRST composed of parallelogram PQRS on the right and triangle PST on the left. PT = PS. Vector RS is a, vector RQ is b.

parts.questionText: Show that $\vec{QS}=\vec{PT}$.
Hence or otherwise, prove that the trapezium is made up of three isosceles triangles PST.

Paper 1.title: Vector Proofs in Trapezium

Paper 1.stem: ORS is a triangle. J is a point on RS such that $RJ:JS=3:2$. $\vec{OR}=\mathbf{r}$ and $\vec{OS}=\mathbf{s}.$
Paper 1.diagramDescription: Triangle ORS. Point J on RS.

parts.questionText: Show that $\vec{OJ}=\frac{1}{5}(2\mathbf{r}+3\mathbf{s})$.
X is a point such that $\vec{RX}=\frac{1}{5}(\mathbf{r}+9\mathbf{s})$. Explain why O, J and X lie on a straight line.

Paper 1.title: Vector Geometry

Paper 2.stem: In the diagram, OABC is a parallelogram and D is the midpoint of BC. BE and OC produced intersect at point F. It is given that BE: $BF=1:3$, OC: OF = 1:2, $\vec{OA}=a$ and $\vec{OC}=c.$
Paper 2.diagramDescription: Parallelogram OABC with OA=a and OC=c. Point D is on BC. Lines are extended to point F such that O-C-F is a straight line and B-E-F is a straight line.

parts.questionText: Express and simplify $\vec{BF}$ in terms of a and c,
Express and simplify $\vec{AE}$ in terms of a and c,
Express and simplify $\vec{OD}$ in terms of a and c.
Determine, with clear working shown, whether points O, D and E lie on a straight line.
Find the value of $\frac{\text{area of triangle CDE}}{\text{area of parallelogram OABC}}$

Paper 2.title: Vectors in Geometry

Paper 2.stem: In the diagram ABCD is a parallelogram. The diagonal AC and BD intersect at E. F is a point on AD such that $\frac{AF}{AD}=\frac{1}{3}$. G is the mid-point of AE. $\vec{AF}=2p$ and $\vec{AB}=6p+4q$.
Paper 2.diagramDescription: Parallelogram ABCD with diagonals intersecting at E. Point F on AD. Point G on AC. Vectors labelled.

parts.questionText: Express $\vec{DE}$ in terms of p and q, as simply as possible.
Express $\vec{AG}$ in terms of p and q, as simply as possible.
Show that $\vec{BG}=-3p-3q$.
Explain why B, G and F lie on a straight line.
Calculate the ratio of the area of triangle ABF to the area of parallelogram ABCD.

Paper 2.title: Vectors in Parallelogram

Paper 2.stem: (a) The position vector of point X is $\binom{8}{-4}$. The position vector of point Y is $\binom{6}{4}.$
Paper 2.diagramDescription: Diagram for part b showing trapezium OABC. OA is parallel to CB. OA=a, OC=2c, CB=2a. P on AC? No, P is on OB?

parts.questionText: Find the vector that represents the translation from X to Y.
Find the magnitude of $\vec{XY}$.
Z has coordinates (-1, k) and lies on the line XY produced. Find the position vector of point Z.
OABC is a trapezium. $\vec{OA}=a$, $\vec{OC}=2c$ and $\vec{CB}=2a.$ $OP:PB=1:3$. Express $\vec{OB}$ in terms of a and c, as simply as possible.
Express $\vec{CP}$ in terms of a and c, as simply as possible.
Explain why C, P and A do not lie on a straight line.
Write down the value of $\frac{\text{area of triangle OBC}}{\text{area of trapezium OABC}}$.

Paper 2.title: Vectors in Geometry

Paper 2.diagramDescription: Diagram for part b showing trapezium OABC. Vector OA=a, OC=2c, CB=2a. P is on OC?

parts.questionText: Given that $\vec{CD}$ is parallel to $\vec{AB}$, find the value of d.
Find $\mid\vec{AC}\mid$.
OABC is a trapezium. $\vec{OA}=a$, $\vec{OC}=2c$ and $\vec{CB}=2a.$ $OP:PB=1:3$. Express $\vec{OB}$ in terms of a and c, as simply as possible.
Express $\vec{CP}$ in terms of a and c, as simply as possible.
Explain why C, P and A do not lie on a straight line.
Write down the value of $\frac{\text{area of triangle OBC}}{\text{area of trapezium OABC}}$.

Paper 2.title: Vector Geometry

Paper 2.stem: (a) Point A is translated to point B by the vector $\binom{-5}{4}$. The position vector of point B is $\binom{3}{8}$.
Paper 2.diagramDescription: Diagram for part b showing quadrilateral OPQR. Vector OP=3p, OR=4r, RQ=7p+4r. B lies on PR.

parts.questionText: Find $\mid\vec{OA}\mid$.
P is a point that lies on AB and has coordinates (k, 10). Find the value of k.
OPQR is a quadrilateral. $\vec{OP}=3p$, $\vec{OR}=4r$ and $\vec{RQ}=7p+4r$. B is a point on PR such that $PB:BR=3:2$. Write down $\vec{OQ}$ in terms of p and r.
Write down $\vec{PQ}$ in terms of p and r.
Write down $\vec{OB}$ in terms of p and r.
Explain why points O, B and Q are not collinear.

Paper 2.title: Vectors
